label.label: Label
label.help: Defines the tab name for this instance

channel-update_timeout.label: Channel Update Timeout
channel-update_timeout.help: Channel list must be this old in hours for update to occur when requested

channel-import_groups.label: Import Channel Groups
channel-import_groups.help: Imports groups from DaddyLive into the group other column

channel-group_name.label: Group Name
channel-group_name.help: By default, the m3u file contains the plugin as a group.  This allows an instance name to be added to the group list during the m3u request. Use simple single words, if possible. If empty, will not add group.

channel-start_ch_num.label: Starting Ch Number
channel-start_ch_num.help: Overrides the channel number starting with the number provided and incrementing by one

player-stream_type.label: stream_type
player-stream_type.help: M3U8 send m3u8 file directly to client.  ffmpeg uses ffmpeg for m3u8 urls. streamlink uses the python module streamlink. internal uses internally coded modules.

player-stream_quality.label: Maximum Stream Quality
player-stream_quality.help: Used with all stream types but m3u8redirect. Maximum bps bandwidth requested for a stream. If a lower bandwidth is available, it is used.  default (999999999) means select the best quality.

player-play_all_segments.label: Play All (VOD)
player-play_all_segments.help: Plays all starting segments and ignores Non-VOD Segments to Start setting. Helpful when the VOD is not set in the provider stream.

player-segments_to_play.label: Non-VOD Segments to Start
player-segments_to_play.help: When starting, will play the last xxx segments. '1' means no buffering. Each increase means about 1-4 seconds of buffering. If the VOD flag is set in the stream, then setting is ignored.

player-enable_url_filter.label: Enable URL Filtering
player-enable_url_filter.help: Only works with internalproxy. Filters out streams from URL addresses based on regular expression

player-enable_pts_filter.label: Enable PTS Filtering
player-enable_pts_filter.help: Works with internalproxy and ffmpegproxy. Filters out corrupted PTS packets.  Requires ffprobe.exe

player-pts_minimum.label: pts_minimum
player-pts_minimum.help: Default 10,000,000 or 108 seconds after midnight. Filters out non-standard streams that whose PTS starts at midnight.

player-pts_max_delta.label: pts_max_delta
player-pts_max_delta.help: Default 3,000,000 or 32 seconds. when playing contiguous blocks of video, filters out any blocks that do not have a continuous PTS counter.

player-enable_pts_resync.label: Enable PTS/DTS Resync
player-enable_pts_resync.help: Works with internalproxy and ffmpegproxy. Corrects timing issues with the video and audio streams and makes them contiguous

player-pts_resync_type.label: PTS/DTS Resync Type
player-pts_resync_type.help: Uses either ffmpeg genpts or internal resequencing

epg-enabled.label: XMLTV Enabled
epg-enabled.help: If disabled, will not ingest or populate the XMLTV output with this instance

epg-prefix.label: EPG Channel Prefix
epg-prefix.help: If a number will ADD to the display channel number; otherwise, will prepend to the channel number as a string

epg-suffix.label: EPG Channel Suffix
epg-suffix.help: Will append to the channel number as a string

epg-days.label: EPG days to load
epg-days.help: Number of days to retrieve from today

epg-episode_adjustment.label: Adjusts Episode number
epg-episode_adjustment.help: Used to record the same episode on two different channels at the same time.  EX: Record the same channel from antenna and DaddyLive at the same time.

epg-start_adjustment.label: Start Time Adjustment
epg-start_adjustment.help: Used to start each program x seconds after the program is suppose to start.

epg-end_adjustment.label: End Time Adjustment
epg-end_adjustment.help: Used to start each program x seconds before the program is suppose to end.

epg-min_refresh_rate.label: EPG Min Refresh Rate
epg-min_refresh_rate.help: Default=3600 seconds (1 hour). When a HTTP request for epg data is received, will refresh the data if older than this value.
